radiographic_examinations.findings: The visualized lung bases appear clear. There are no pleural effusions. The appendix is dilated up to 11 mm in diameter with a perceptible enhancing wall and surrounding fat stranding, most consistent with acute uncomplicated appendicitis. The lower sigmoid colon shows slight wall thickening, probably secondary due to exudate noting a small quantity of probably inflammatory ascites in the area. No other abnormalities noted in the gallbladder, pancreas, adrenal glands, kidneys, prostate, seminal vesicles, distal ureters, bladder or major mesenteric vessels. No enlarged lymph nodes or ascites detected.
